Let $a,$ $b,$ and $c$ be distinct real numbers such that
\[\frac{a^3 + 6}{a} = \frac{b^3 + 6}{b} = \frac{c^3 + 6}{c}.\]Find $a^3 + b^3 + c^3.$
inference:
Solution:
From the given equation, we have $a^3 + 6 = ab^2 + 6b/a,$ $b^3 + 6 = bc^2 + 6c/b,$ and $c^3 + 6 = ca^2 + 6a/c.$ Adding these equations, we get
\[a^3 + b^3 + c^3 + 18 = ab^2 + bc^2 + ca^2 + 6b/a + 6c/b + 6a/c.\]We can write
\begin{align*}
ab^2 + bc^2 + ca^2 &= a^2 (b + c) + bc (b + c) \\
&= (a^2 + bc) (b + c) \\
&= (a^2 + bc) (a + b + c - a) \\
&= a^3 + a^2 b + a^2 c + abc - a^3 - abc \\
&= a^2 b + a^2 c.
\end{align*}Hence,
\[a^3 + b^3 + c^3 + 18 = a^2 b + a^2 c + 6b/a + 6c/b + 6a/c.\]Let $x = a^2 b + a^2 c + 6b/a + 6c/b + 6a/c.$  Then
\[a^3 + b^3 + c^3 + 18 = x.\]From the given equation, $a^3 + 6 = ab^2 + 6b/a,$ so $a^3 - ab^2 - 6b/a + 6 = 0.$  This factors as $(a - b)(a^2 + ab + 6) = 0.$  Since $a$ and $b$ are distinct, $a^2 + ab + 6 = 0.$  Similarly, $b^2 + bc + 6 = 0$ and $c^2 + ca + 6 = 0.$  Adding these equations, we get
\[a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + ab + bc + ca = 0.\]Then
\begin{align*}
x &= a^2 b + a^2 c + 6b/a + 6c/b + 6a/c \\
&= a^2 (b + c) + 6 (b/a + c/b + a/c) \\
&= a^2 (a + b + c - a) + 6 (b/a + c/b + a/c) \\
&= a^3 + a^2 b + a^2 c + 6 (b/a + c/b + a/c) - a^3 \\
&= a^2 b + a^2 c + 6 (b/a + c/b + a/c) \\
&= -(ab + bc + ca) + 6 (b/a + c/b + a/c) \\
&= 6 (b/a + c/b + a/c).
\end{align*}We can write
\begin{align*}
\frac{b}{a} + \frac{c}{b} + \frac{a}{c} &= \frac{b^2 c + ac^2 + a^2 b}{abc} \\
&= \frac{(b^2 c + ac^2 + a^2 b) (a + b + c)}{(abc) (a + b + c)} \\
&= \frac{a^2 b^2 c + ab^3 c + abc^3 + a^3 c^2 + a^2 b^2 c + abc^3 + a^3 b^2 + a^2 bc^2 + a^2 b^2 c}{(abc) (a + b + c)} \\
&= \frac{2a^2 b^2 c + ab^3 c + 2abc^3 + a^3 c^2 + a^3 b^2 + a^2 bc^2}{(abc) (a + b + c)} \\
&= \frac{ab^2 c (a + b) + ac^2 (a^2 + b^2) + abc^2 (a + c)}{(abc) (a + b + c)} \\
&= \frac{ab^2 (a + b) + ac^2 (a^2 + b^2) + abc^2 (a + c)}{(abc) (a + b + c)} \\
&= \frac{b^2 (a^2 + ab) + c^2 (a^3 + ab^2) + bc^2 (a + c)}{(abc) (a + b + c)} \\
&= \frac{b^2 (-6) + c^2 (-6b) + bc^2 (a + c)}{(abc) (a + b + c)} \\
&= \frac{-6b^2 - 6bc^2 + bc^2 (a + c)}{(abc) (a + b + c)} \\

Let
\[k = \frac{a^3 + 6}{a} = \frac{b^3 + 6}{b} = \frac{c^3 + 6}{c}.\]Then $a,$ $b,$ and $c$ are all roots of
\[k = \frac{x^3 + 6}{x},\]or $x^3 - kx + 6 = 0.$  By Vieta's formulas, $a + b + c = 0.$

Also,
\begin{align*}
a^3 - ka + 6 &= 0, \\
b^3 - kb + 6 &= 0, \\
c^3 - kc + 6 &= 0.
\end{align*}Adding these, we get $a^3 + b^3 + c^3 - k(a + b + c) + 18 = 0,$ so $a^3 + b^3 + c^3 = k(a + b + c) - 18 = \boxed{-18}.$

Let
\[k = \frac{a^3 + 6}{a} = \frac{b^3 + 6}{b} = \frac{c^3 + 6}{c}.\]Then $a,$ $b,$ and $c$ are all roots of
\[k = \frac{x^3 + 6}{x},\]or $x^3 - kx + 6 = 0.$  By Vieta's formulas, $a + b + c = 0.$

Also,
\begin{align*}
a^3 - ka + 6 &= 0, \\
b^3 - kb + 6 &= 0, \\
c^3 - kc + 6 &= 0.
\end{align*}Adding these, we get $a^3 + b^3 + c^3 - k(a + b + c) + 18 = 0,$ so $a^3 + b^3 + c^3 = k(a + b + c) - 18 = \boxed{-18}.$
